Posts.Content: May 18, 2013 03:22PM - edited May 18, 2013 03:28PM by sweetrose8 Hello  Yes, I've also experienced and it is still black- both the fingernails and toenails. During chemotherapy my oncologist said that there are chances of nails developing black lines on the nails.  I thought that as my chemo ends the nails will quickly recover and get my beautiful clear nails back.. but unfortunately i haven't!! Sometimes it's more than difficult to stay patient!  Slowly the blackness is fading away of the fingernails and from the bottom going to the top as the nail keeps on growing- though slow growth.. The first two in my guess was the cause of blackening nails. PLEASE! The ones who are reading, can you please suggest some care tips which has worked wonders for you in this situation? I've heard some supplements for nails, skin + hair are available to improve the condition but don't know how much true and beneficial it is? and is this blackening a permanent side-effect? (hope not!) Would be nice if some light is shed on this! Thanks
